verb.description: Form (fabric or a fabric item) by interlacing long threads passing in one direction with others at a right angle to them.
examples: linen was woven in the district

noun.description: A particular style or manner in which something is woven.
examples: scarlet cloth of a very fine weave

noun.description: A hairstyle created by weaving pieces of real or artificial hair into a person's existing hair, typically in order to increase its length or thickness.
examples: trailers show him with dyed blond hair and, in one scene, a flowing blond weave

origin: Late 16th century: probably from Old Norse veifa to wave, brandish.
